messages_and_choices.content:
Persona: You are an experienced salesperson who specializes in demonstrating perfect product–market fit.
Task: Write a personalized cold email pitching the <product> to the <customer>. The email must construct a compelling argument based on a logical chain that explains why the <product> is a perfect fit for the <customer>.

Inputs: Use tools to fetch the following from the knowledge graph (KG).
<customer> — The "Customer Job" node content (retrieve via get_relevant_context starting from 'Customer Job').
<product> — The "Product Feature" node content (ensure your evidence path reaches a node whose id contains 'Product Feature').
<nodes> — The sequence of intermediate node contents along the path from Customer Job → … → Product Feature (gather via get_connected_nodes and get_relevant_context).

Logic (internal): Base your argument on the ordered node chain from <customer> to <product>. Use those facts to justify fit, benefits, and outcomes. Do not output your chain-of-thought; only output the email content grounded in those facts.

Output requirements:
- Write the email yourself (subject + body).
- Be concise, specific, and benefit-led; include a clear CTA.
- Use English for all outputs.
- Ground claims in the KG evidence you retrieved.
- Always cite all node_ids used via finalize_email.

Workflow:
1) Use get_connected_nodes to browse neighbors from 'Customer Job' as needed.
2) Use get_relevant_context(node_id) to retrieve a short evidence block (it prefers paths that reach a 'Product Feature' node) and accumulate citations.
3) Write your own subject and body using that context.
4) Call finalize_email(subject, body, citations).

Policy:
- Always end by calling finalize_email; do not output the email directly.
- As soon as subject and body are drafted, call finalize_email in the same turn.
- If you are running out of turns, summarize citations and call finalize_email.

        Prospect: Alex Rivera (VP Engineering) at Acme FinTech in FinTech
        Goal: Secure a 20-minute discovery call
        Starting nodes: ['Customer Job']
Generate a grounded email by calling tools. End by calling finalize_email.

messages_and_choices.name: get_connected_nodes
messages_and_choices.content: ['synthetic-data-generation-methods-591d4628', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-d3367c40', 'data-augmentation-techniques-18b0c581', 'ai-model-training-7806df8e', 'data-privacy-regulations-affc4d3b']

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': 'Data augmentation techniques artificially increase the size of a training dataset by creating modified versions of existing data. 
Synthetic data can inherit or amplify biases present in the original data or the generation process. 
Data privacy regulations like GDPR and CCPA impose restrictions on the collection, use, and storage of personal data. 
Common AI model evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. 
Evaluation metrics for synthetic data include fidelity (how well it represents the original data) and privacy (how well it protects sensitive information).', 'citations': ['data-augmentation-techniques-ddb4a3c5', 'synthetic-data-bias-8ffce812', 'data-privacy-regulations-7756e0a7', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-de443b2b', 'metrics-for-synthetic-data-459bf847']}

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content: {'text': 'Weights and Biases Weave, featuring a UI for feedback and model evaluation. \nEvaluation metrics for synthetic data include fidelity (how well it represents the original data) and privacy (how well it protects sensitive information).', 'citations': ['Product Feature', 'metrics-for-synthetic-data-459bf847']}

messages_and_choices.name: get_connected_nodes
messages_and_choices.content: ['synthetic-data-generation-methods-591d4628', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-d3367c40', 'data-augmentation-techniques-18b0c581', 'ai-model-training-7806df8e', 'data-privacy-regulations-affc4d3b']

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': "Data augmentation techniques, including the use of GANs and VAEs, artificially increase the size of training datasets. 
Synthetic data is often used as training data for machine learning models. 
Bias detection methods are crucial for evaluating synthetic data, ensuring it doesn't perpetuate or amplify biases present in the real-world data. 
Metrics to evaluate synthetic data quality include privacy risk, utility preservation, and representational accuracy. 
An AI model training pipeline typically includes data preprocessing, model selection, hyperparameter tuning, training, validation, and testing.", 'citations': ['data-augmentation-techniques-18135189', 'model-training-data-35c37672', 'bias-detection-methods-a8156b02', 'synthetic-data-evaluation-metrics-203465ba', 'ai-model-training-pipeline-b9b2ce8b']}

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': 'Dataset bias mitigation refers to techniques used to reduce or eliminate biases present in datasets used for training machine learning models. 
Synthetic data is artificially created data that mimics real data, used to train machine learning models when real data is scarce or contains privacy concerns. 
Data augmentation techniques artificially increase the size of a dataset by creating modified versions of existing data. 
AI model training is the process of teaching an AI model to perform a specific task by feeding it large amounts of data. 
Model evaluation metrics are quantitative measures used to assess the performance of a machine learning model, such as accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.', 'citations': ['dataset-bias-mitigation-a11b9b28', 'synthetic-data-generation-b10d1b81', 'data-augmentation-techniques-18b0c581', 'ai-model-training-8bf5a69d', 'model-evaluation-metrics-6b843e66']}

messages_and_choices.content: ['synthetic-data-generation-methods-591d4628', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-d3367c40', 'data-augmentation-techniques-18b0c581', 'ai-model-training-7806df8e', 'data-privacy-regulations-affc4d3b']

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': 'Data quality metrics for synthetic data include fidelity (how closely it resembles real data), diversity, and privacy preservation. 
AI model evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. 
Synthetic data can introduce bias if not generated carefully, which can negatively impact the performance and fairness of AI models trained on it. 
Human-in-the-loop evaluation involves incorporating human feedback into the model evaluation process, often through labeling or scoring data. 
Evaluating AI models, particularly synthetic data models, can be challenging due to the need for diverse and representative test datasets.', 'citations': ['data-quality-metrics-f9c2342a', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-d3367c40', 'synthetic-data-bias-a38b102f', 'human-in-the-loop-evaluation-1fb6b150', 'model-evaluation-challenges-3988669a']}
